events.message: The claimant reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection involving significant vehicle damage.
The report was reviewed, and the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the accident claim and assist the claimant throughout the process.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and confirmed initiation of the process.
The claimant was asked to provide all relevant documents such as police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted the requested police report, photos of the car damage, and repair shop quotes for review.
An investigation was started to verify the details of the vehicle collision and validate submitted evidence and documents.
The investigation concluded successfully confirming the circumstances of the accident matched the claimantâ€™s account.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the claimant for the vehicle repair costs and associated damages.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the offer made.
After review and claimant agreement, the insurance claim was formally approved by the claims department.
The settlement amount was processed and payment issued to the claimant for vehicle repairs and damages.
The claim file was officially closed following successful resolution and payment issuance for the auto accident.
All claim documents and correspondences were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
